result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory J. Volkening was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cory J. Volkening in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Cory J. Volkening in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:55
Calling 15cf260,15cf210 and 15cm187 and 15tr2924 - agreement reached on all cases
15CF260   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. - Information filed- In receipt, waive reading - 
15cf260 - state moves to dismiss but read in count 1 - granted - 
15cf210 - State moves to amend count 1 to CT to dwelling - 943.14 and  Dismiss but read in coutn 3- Granted - 
15CM187 - State moves to dismiss dismiss but read in count 2- Granted
Plea questionnaires filed -  - No contest plea to 15TR2924, Count 2 as charged in 15cf260 , count 1 as charged in 15cm187 and 15cf210 count 1 as charged and count 2 as amended -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
15TR2924- Court imposes fine of $ 762 - taken from bond posted/6 month revocation/assessment - 
Bednar Clemens/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing
15cf260 - Court WHS and POP for 3 years - 23 days credit if revoked 
CC/CV/Supervision fees/DNAAS - costs to be taken from bond posted - AODA and recovery as recommended.   Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO - 
15CF210 count 2- Court WHS and POP for 2 years  CC/CV  Restitution of 1028.50 total to be taken from bond posted and paid first - AODA and recovery as recommended - any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Count 1 - Court sentences to 8 months jail - huber for all purposes - Costs of $243 to be taken from bond posted - Credit for 25 days- COurt would allow day to day credit for impatient treatment if successful and at the tail end of sentence - 
15CM187 - Court WHS and POP For 2 years - CC - Credit for 1 days if revoked 
CC/CV/Supervision fees/Domestic abuse surcharge from bond posted - 
AODA and recovery as recommended - any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights/Voting rights given 
Any bond left over to be forfeited - order to be done and sent for signature

2:02 p.m. Defendant Cory J. Volkening in court, via video, with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Cory J. Volkening in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf260, 15cf210 and 15cm187. Schiek/Voorhees statement to bail. Court sets $ bond. May leave jail for AODA treatment if Court is provided with proof of in-patient admission in Oneida County.  Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Per Mary, ONSO - in custody/Portage - waiting for transport
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

3:14 p.m. Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees statement to defendant's non-appearance. Court authorizes warrant. Voorhees will attempt to contact and schedule voluntary appearance. Adj. 3:16 p.m.

1:35 p.m. Defendant Cory J. Volkening in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees did not know that defendant was appearing but represents on other cases - will make special appearance subject to defendant contacting PD's office and determining eligibility. Intra circuit transfer to Branch 1. Schiek/Voorhees/Defendant statement to bail. Court sets $1000 cash bond. In receipt of complaint - waive further reading - Voorhees to obtain date from Branch 1 JA for Preliminary Hearing.
